item.description:
The culmination of the BEST prize winning stories told this season at Doyle's Cafe under the following themes: 

  • Emergency,
  • Supernatural
  • Obsession
  • Gifts
  • Resolution
  • Cupid 

You don't want to miss this night!

Winners will go on to the Big Mouth Off to compete with finalists from other Boston slams on April 11, 2012 at Coolidge Corner Theater's main theater to compete for a week in a medieval townhouse in Tuscany and other prizes. 

Tickets: $15

http://jpsemifinals-eorg.eventbrite.com/

Regulary recognized as Boston's best bar and restaurant, Doyle's offers and unmatched mix of good food, good talk and good people.  Doyle's is host to one of New England's largest selections of draft beer.  The mahogany bar dates back over 125 years to 1882.  Doyle's is located in the Jamaica Plain neighborhood of Boston, accesible by the Orange line and close to the Sam Adams Brewery!

Nearest transit: Green Street (Orange Line)

"Because you have a life, you have a story. Bring it!"


Listen to our podcasts at iTunes and podcast webpage. 
Check out our video archive to get an idea about 5 minute stories.
Learn about the rules of the story slam. 
Learn how you can be sure to tell a story here.


Other massmouth Semi Finals this season:

Johhny D's , Somerville, MA Semi-Finals March 14, 7:00-10:00PM


Club Passim in Cambridge, MA Semi finals in March 19, 2012 8:00-10:00PM

group.name: Greater Boston and MA Storytelling Meetup Group

item.name: Doyle's - SEMI FINAL Story Slam
